intro: Peucedanum medicum var. gracile, commonly known as slender angelica, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white to greenish in color, arranged in compound umbels. The roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties, containing compounds like sesquiterpene lactones and volatile oils.
